sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: An historic day as Ukraine is one step closer to EU membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: G7 nations are calling for humanitarian pauses to speed up aid to desperate civilians in the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Displaced families in Gaza's tented refugee camps struggle to feed themselves as Israel's blockade leaves them cut off from basic foodstuffs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: International agencies say 160 children in Gaza are dying every day and hundreds more are being injured in Israeli bombardments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is one step closer to joining the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has recommended member states formally open accession talks with Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Although outstanding work on fundamental reforms needs to be met in the coming months, nonetheless, the president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, said today was a historical day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It is now 10 years ago that the protests on Maidan started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Maidan protests where people were shot because they wrapped themselves into a European flag.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And now, 10 years later, today is a historic day because today the Commission recommends that the Council opens accession negotiations with Ukraine and with Moldova.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In a 150-page assessment, the EU says Ukraine has made significant progress in tackling corruption, the influence of oligarchs on political life, the rights of minorities and the independence of the judicial system, although some more work is required in these areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Speaking to Euronews, Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister said these issues would be resolved soon and oligarchs would no longer be a problem in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Experts and leaders of opinion have said oligarchs are officially dead not from the physical point of view but as a um as a as as a creation of the post-soviet transition period so there are many things to be accomplished but basically we have been um uh recognized as a country which has overcame this influence and there will there is no way back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The EU strongly commended Ukraine's progress in the midst of the Russian invasion of their country, which created the momentum for theirs and Moldova's membership bid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: All 27 member states have to unanimously agree to move Ukraine to accession talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If all goes to plan, a timeline for starting negotiations would then emerge for early 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A pro-Russian politician has been killed in an apparent car bomb attack in Ukraine's occupied

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Luhansk region. Mikhail Filipanenko's son told local media he died after suffering fatal injuries in the explosion. He was the only person in the car. Filipanenko was a member of the so-called People's Council, a local parliament set up by Moscow-aligned officials. Luhansk is one of four Ukrainian regions illegally annexed by Russia after its invasion in February 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: annexed by Russia after its invasion in February 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The G7 group of rich nations has called on Israel to pause its military offensive in Gaza on humanitarian grounds. At their meeting in Japan, leaders overcame diverging views on the war to issue a joint statement that fell some ways short of advocating for a ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken did say Israel should not try to reoccupy Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The G7 ministers reaffirmed our staunch support for Israel's right and obligation to defend itself and seek to ensure the attacks of October 7th can never happen again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We all agreed that humanitarian pauses would advance key objectives to protect Palestinian civilians, to increase the sustained flow of humanitarian assistance, to allow our citizens and foreign nationals to exit, and to facilitate the release of hostages. The country's foreign ministers also condemned the rise of extremist settler violence committed against Palestinians, which they said undermined security in the occupied West Bank and threatened the prospect for a lasting peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They fled their homes without money or belongings and have nothing to put in their mouths.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Those displaced by the war in Gaza are suffering a war of hunger on top of the horror they left behind. In this camp, getting one meal a day is mission impossible. أحياناً أمي عندما تأتي لتطبيق الطعام لأنها توزع الطعام وأحياناً أأكل الغيب وأحياناً أنام بالجوع لأنه يبقى خبز أمي في المدينة قالت مكتب يورو نيوز في غازا نيبال هاجو أن الحياة هناك صعبة جداً لقد وضعوا الكثير من الأيام بدون أي طعام ومشاركة المصدرات مع المساعدين في المدينة Nibal Hadjou that life there is very difficult. They've spent many days without any food, sharing supplies with neighbours in the camp.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Nibal Hadjou, A The blockade on humanitarian aid in the Gaza Strip has left markets depleted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Many families have traded certain death under bombs for a slow death in refugee camps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In Gaza, women and children are at the heart of an unfolding humanitarian catastrophe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: According to the World Health Organization, on average 160 children are killed and hundreds injured every day in the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: More than 4,000 children have been confirmed dead and more than 1,500 are missing, assumed dead under the rubble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Children now under intense bombardments all day and night. They are lacking food, water, electricity, medicine, everything. And on top of that, without electricity, you can't imagine the horror and fear they are living when it's completely dark. And the only sound they hear is just the sound of bombardments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: JOSEPH BIDEN, American President of the United States, bombardments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Families are facing harsh conditions with the lack of clean water, food and medical care and facilities such as schools and hospitals overwhelmed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Collapsing and destroyed sanitation systems are increasing the risk of spreading water borne diseases including cholera.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And what about the longer term issues of growing up in a war zone? So we are risking a generation that is not going to be able to be productive adults, not going to be able to interact with their surroundings and be as productive as they can be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They will not reach their full potential.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And of course, there's the issue of the cycle of violence and we're creating violence never is the solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Violence only produces violence and I think the sole solution for this is to stop violence and find a solution, a political solution for the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Last month was the hottest October on record globally, meaning 2023 is almost certainly going to hit a new peak as the warmest year ever recorded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That's according to the latest information from Copernicus, Europe's climate data service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: October was 0.4 degrees Celsius hotter than 2019's previous record for the month and follows a record-setting trend over the summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: previous record for the month and follows a record-setting trend over the summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The real-life impacts of climate change are already being felt, with a fall in olive oil production among the most conspicuous effects on agriculture. Separately, a new UN report reveals that in the coming years, major oil, gas and coal-producing countries plan to extract more than double the amount of fossil fuels recommended by the Paris Climate Accord. The groundbreaking agreement seeks to keep global temperature rises below 1.5 degrees Celsius. The study says governments plan to produce 110 percent more fossil fuels than required to stay within that limit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Last weekend's heavy snowfall has been welcomed by many in the Alps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It means some ski resorts are already turning into winter wonderlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: More than 60 centimeters of snow fell at an altitude of 2,400 meters, building up a base layer of snow and kickstartant la saison. Ça crée une certaine émulation auprès de la clientèle pour les sports d'hiver et ça nous permet de vendre au mieux nos abonnements annuels.

sentences.sentence: On avait besoin de neige, on a perdu 3 mètres de glace cet été encore une fois.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Alors on a besoin de neige, après si on cumule il y a 1 mètre, 2 mètres qui tombent rapidement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: C'était encore assez chaud, il y avait aussi du gel qui s'est fait, de la glace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Et après ça on a besoin de temps pour rouvrir les installations et préparer le domaine skiable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Arsenal est maintenant en train de se concentrer sur la Ligue des Champions, car ils accueillent Sevilla Sevilla to the Emirates this evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Two weeks after edging out the Europa League champions in Spain, a win could potentially guarantee the Gunners a passage to the knockout phase with two games in hand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Mikel Arteta's men are currently top of Group B, but the Arsenal manager will be without Thomas Partey and Gabriel Jesus, while Martin Odegaard remains doubtful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Sevilla will be looking to get back to winning ways after picking up just two points in their last three group games, however veteran defender Sergio Ramos is likely to miss out with a muscle injury.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Spaniards have so far made a habit of drawing since Diego Alonso was appointed as manager and are currently struggling in La Liga as they sit 15th with 11 points from 11 games.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Group B's other fixture, the surprise package Loss will aim to continue their fairytale run in the competition when they lock horns with PSV Eindhoven at the Philips Stadium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere FC Copenhagen host Manchester United, while Bayern Munich could book their place in the knockout phase with a win over Galatasaray.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Group C, Napoli welcome Union Berlin, whilst Sporting Braga will face a tough trip to the Bernabeu to face group leaders Real Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Group D, Benfica will be hoping to secure their first points when they take on Real Sociedad, with Inter and Salzburg facing off in the other game.
